conditional loss of function.description: loss-of-function is predicted or assumed (by the literature) under specific conditions only

cooperative polygenic gain of function.description: alterations that have an additive effect together which is not observed with either alteration alone

diagnostic indicator.description: evidence is diagnostic for a specific disease type, disease subtype or disease state

disruptive fusion.description: fusion disrupts the wild-type functionality of one or more of its fusion partners

dominant gain of function.description: an event whose product adversely affects the normal product resulting in a gain-of-function phenotype

dominant negative.description: an event whose product adversely affects the normal product resulting in a loss-of-function phenotype

extension.description: A protein change which extends the open reading frame

gain of function.description: event imparts an acquired function on the product leading to a specific observable phenotype

haploinsufficient.description: an event leading to loss of function in a product that is dosage dependant such that the incomplete loss of function leads to an observable phenotype when event is in a heterozygous state

increased function.description: the efficacy or frequency of the existing functionality is increased

increased signature.description: Increased measure is expected with respect to some reference signature element

intermediate metabolizer.description: intermediate metabolizer: with a genotype carrying one normal function allele plus one no function allele or one decreased function allele, or carrying two decreased function alleles

is characteristic of.description: a hallmark of this disease type

likely gain of function.description: gain-of-function is predicted or assumed (by the literature) based on an inference of similar events or data

likely loss of function.description: loss-of-function is predicted or assumed (by the literature) based on an inference of similar events or data

loss of function.description: some normal functionality has been lost

loss of function mutation.description: some normal functionality has been lost as a result of a mutation

low level copy gain.description: A copy gain that is not also considered an amplification

mutation.description: generally small mutations or intra-chromosomal rearrangements

mutation hotspot.description: the specific residue noted has been observed to be recurrently and commonly mutated at some signifiant frequency above random in numerrous independent observations

neomorphic.description: gain of a novel molecular function that is distinct from wild-type function

no dominant negative.description: does not adversely affect the normal product in a dominant negative manner

no functional effect.description: does not result in altered functionality as compared to the wild-type

no resistance.description: does not confer increased resistance as compared to wild-type state

no sensitivity.description: does not confer increased sensitivity as compared to wild-type state

oncogenic.description: having the potential to cause a normal cell to become cancerous

patient.description: Used in statements (primarily prognostic) to indicate when something applies to a patient (ex. increased survival)

phenotype absent.description: condition is not associated with a phenotype (ex. condition is not expected to be associated with high mutation burden)

phenotype present.description: condition is associated with a phenotype (ex. condition is expected to be associated with high mutation burden)

phenotype variant.description: Variation is expected with respect to some reference phenotype element

poor metabolizer.description: with a genotype carrying two no function alleles, or carrying one no function plus one decreased function allele

protective.description: protect against some disease or phenotype. Associated with decreased risk of the disease or phenotype

reduced function.description: the efficacy or frequency of the existing functionality is reduced

reduced signature.description: Decreased measure is expected with respect to some reference signature element

signature absent.description: Some signature (ex. mutational signature) is not expected

signature present.description: Some signature (ex. mutational signature) is expected

signature variant.description: Variation is expected with respect to some reference signature element

small mutation.description: any substitution, insertion or deletion affecting a small number of base pairs

switch of function.description: some wild-type/normal functionality is lost and some novel functionality is gained

targetable.description: therapy can be used given some event or combination of event

tumour suppressive.description: suppresses or blocks the development of cancer

unaltered function.description: event is not associated with a change in protein function

unfavourable prognosis.description: event is associated with a specifed, unfavouable outcome
